qas.question: What federal court is located in Richmond?

answers.text: United States Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit

qas.question: Along with Philip Morris and CapitalOne, what prominent corporation is present in Richmond?
What type of business is LeClairRyan?
When did the Troutman Sanders-Mays & Valentine LLP merger occur?
How many Federal Reserve Banks exist in the United States?

context: Law and finance have long been driving forces in the economy. The city is home to both the <a0_0>United States Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit<a0_0/>, one of 13 United States courts of appeals, and the Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond, one of <a4_0>12<a4_0/> Federal Reserve Banks, as well as offices for international companies such as <a1_0>Genworth Financial<a1_0/>, CapitalOne, Philip Morris USA, and numerous other banks and brokerages. Richmond is also home to four of the largest <a2_0>law firms<a2_0/> in the United States: Hunton & Williams, McGuireWoods, Williams Mullen, and LeClairRyan. Another law firm with a major Richmond presence is Troutman Sanders, which merged with Richmond-based Mays & Valentine LLP in <a3_0>2001<a3_0/>.
